title: How to Assemble a Signateur 5 Burner Grill

steps.headline: Prepare a good working area.
steps.description: Choose an area that is near the location you want the final home for the grill to be. Make sure the area is open and clear of debris.

steps.headline: Gather the proper tools for unboxing and assembly.
steps.description: For most new grills, this will include a razor or scissors and a screw driver.

steps.headline: Unbox the grill from the packaging.
Remove the packing straps from the box.
steps.description: Using a razor, cut the 2 white straps and remove them.

steps.headline: Remove the top of the box.
Remove all of the loose parts from the grill and set them aside.
steps.description: First, cut the white plastic strap with the razor. Then remove the handle for the grill lid, warming rack, and two boxes. Next, remove the 3 grates and the flame guard. Make sure to note the orientation of the warming rack, flame guard and cooking racks. This will be helpful for re-installation later.

steps.headline: Remove the grill from the base of the box.
Confirm all parts and hardware are accounted for.
steps.description: Open the boxes, remove all the parts and remove the protective covers. Make sure to use the parts list and check off each item and confirm the quantity. During this process, it is also good to inspect any items that may be damaged. If any parts are missing or damaged, call the manufacturer to get them replaced. Do not move on until everything is accounted for.

steps.headline: Install the handle from the grill lid.
steps.description:
The handle already has the mounting screw and base washer attached. First, remove the screws and base washer from both sides of the handle. Set the base washers over each of the two the mounting holes. Set the handle in place so that it rests on the base washers. Hold the handle in place with one hand. Use the other hand to install the screws from the inside of the lid. Once both screws have been started, tighten the hardware to make sure it is secured in place. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/30\/Handle-lid.jpg\/459px-Handle-lid.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/3\/30\/Handle-lid.jpg\/728px-Handle-lid.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Install the left side door handle.
steps.description:
Use the white paper tab to open the door and gain access to the mounting holes from the inside. Next remove the screws and base washer from both sides of the handle. Hold one end of the door handle so that it is aligned with the mounting hole and use a screw driver in the opposite hand to install a screw through the mounting hole on the inside of the door. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7e\/Left-On.jpg\/459px-Left-On.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/7\/7e\/Left-On.jpg\/728px-Left-On.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Repeat this for the opposite side of the handle. Once both screws have been started, then tighten the hardware to make sure it is secured in place.

steps.headline: Install the right-side door handle.
steps.description: Repeat the process for the handle installation on the right-side door.

steps.headline: Re-install the interior cooking parts to the grill.
Install the left side burner assembly.
Install the right side table.
steps.description:
This is a very similar process to installing the left side, but the right side does not contain a burner. Locate the 4 pre-attached mounting screws. Loosen the top two screws about half way and remove the bottom two. Attach right-side table in place using the top two mounting screws. Once in place tighten the top two screws
Re-install the bottom two screws to securely fasten in place.

steps.headline: Hang the grease cup.
steps.description: Open both doors to the grill. Locate the hanger for the grease cup and slide the grease cup into place until it is level and the tabs stop it from sliding out.

steps.headline: Install the batteries for the grill.
Confirm the LP gas tank is full.
steps.description: Check if the tank is full; if the tank is not full, exchange it for a full tank.

steps.headline: Install the LP gas tank onto the grill.
Connect the LP hose and regulator to the LP gas tank.
steps.description: Grab the LP hose and regulator that is located inside the right door or the grill. Holding the gas tank with one hand insert the brass nipple from the LP tank into the large black plastic nut. Turn the nut clockwise by hand until it stops turning. It is very important to make sure the hose is not damaged and has no kinks.

text:
Preparing for Assembly Prepare a good working area. Choose an area that is near the location you want the final home for the grill to be. Make sure the area is open and clear of debris. Gather the proper tools for unboxing and assembly. For most new grills, this will include a razor or scissors and a screw driver. Unbox the grill from the packaging. Remove the packing straps from the box. Using a razor, cut the 2 white straps and remove them. Remove the top of the box. Then remove the corner box wedges. There will be one located in each corner. Grab each one individually and pull them up and out of the box. They might be a little snug and this is normal. With the wedges removed, the body of the box will be loose. Lift the body of the box up and over the grill. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/39/Webo.jpg/459px-Webo.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/3/39/Webo.jpg/728px-Webo.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Lastly remove the plastic protector off the grill by lifting if off. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6d/Plast.jpg/460px-Plast.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/6/6d/Plast.jpg/432px-Plast.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":596,"bigWidth":"432","bigHeight":"560","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Remove all of the loose parts from the grill and set them aside. First, cut the white plastic strap with the razor. Then remove the handle for the grill lid, warming rack, and two boxes. Next, remove the 3 grates and the flame guard. Make sure to note the orientation of the warming rack, flame guard and cooking racks. This will be helpful for re-installation later. Remove the grill from the base of the box. With all of the parts and items removed, the grill body will be as light as it can get. Use the razor and cut the front of the base. Cut each side and follow the arrows and dashed lines as a guide for the cutting locations. Next push down on the front flap of the box base. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b8/Flap.jpg/459px-Flap.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/b8/Flap.jpg/728px-Flap.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Now pull the body of the grill forwards with little side to side motions until it is free from the base of the box. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/93/Off-base.jpg/459px-Off-base.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/9/93/Off-base.jpg/728px-Off-base.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Assembling the Grill Confirm all parts and hardware are accounted for. Open the boxes, remove all the parts and remove the protective covers. Make sure to use the parts list and check off each item and confirm the quantity. During this process, it is also good to inspect any items that may be damaged. If any parts are missing or damaged, call the manufacturer to get them replaced. Do not move on until everything is accounted for. Install the handle from the grill lid. The handle already has the mounting screw and base washer attached. First, remove the screws and base washer from both sides of the handle. Set the base washers over each of the two the mounting holes. Set the handle in place so that it rests on the base washers. Hold the handle in place with one hand. Use the other hand to install the screws from the inside of the lid. Once both screws have been started, tighten the hardware to make sure it is secured in place. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/30/Handle-lid.jpg/459px-Handle-lid.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/3/30/Handle-lid.jpg/728px-Handle-lid.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Install the left side door handle. Use the white paper tab to open the door and gain access to the mounting holes from the inside. Next remove the screws and base washer from both sides of the handle. Hold one end of the door handle so that it is aligned with the mounting hole and use a screw driver in the opposite hand to install a screw through the mounting hole on the inside of the door. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7e/Left-On.jpg/459px-Left-On.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/7/7e/Left-On.jpg/728px-Left-On.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Repeat this for the opposite side of the handle. Once both screws have been started, then tighten the hardware to make sure it is secured in place. Install the right-side door handle. Repeat the process for the handle installation on the right-side door. Re-install the interior cooking parts to the grill. These were removed earlier, where the orientation should have been noted. Install the flame guard making tabs are facing the back of the grill and set it in place so that it sits securely on the tabs. Install the 3 cooking grates starting with the first one in the far left and then install the following two moving to the right. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Cook-Grate.jpg/459px-Cook-Grate.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/0/08/Cook-Grate.jpg/728px-Cook-Grate.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Install the warming rack so it sits securely onto the tabs and make sure the raised edge is upwards and closest to the back of the grill. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2f/Warm.jpg/459px-Warm.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/2/2f/Warm.jpg/728px-Warm.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Install the left side burner assembly. Locate the 4 pre-attached mounting screws. Loosen the top two screws about half way and remove the bottom two. Attach the burner assembly to the left side by aligning the top mounting holes to the loosened screws. Be careful to make sure to insert the side valve assembly from the side of the grill into the side burner assembly during this process. Tighten the top two mounting screws. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6f/Venturi.jpg/459px-Venturi.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/6/6f/Venturi.jpg/728px-Venturi.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Re-Install the bottom two screws and tighten to secure the side burner assembly into place. Locate the Igniter lead wire that is taped to the left side of the grill and attach the lead wire to the igniter electrode by firmly pushing it into place. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bf/Ignite-cable.jpg/459px-Ignite-cable.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/bf/Ignite-cable.jpg/728px-Ignite-cable.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Install the right side table. This is a very similar process to installing the left side, but the right side does not contain a burner. Locate the 4 pre-attached mounting screws. Loosen the top two screws about half way and remove the bottom two. Attach right-side table in place using the top two mounting screws. Once in place tighten the top two screws Re-install the bottom two screws to securely fasten in place. Hang the grease cup. Open both doors to the grill. Locate the hanger for the grease cup and slide the grease cup into place until it is level and the tabs stop it from sliding out. Install the batteries for the grill. Open the right-side door and locate the igniter box. It sits just inside the door on the right-hand side near the top of the cabinet. Remove the igniter cap located on the bottom of the igniter box. Install 1 AA battery with the positive side going into the cap and re-install the igniter cap into the assembly. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Igbat.jpg/459px-Igbat.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/1/14/Igbat.jpg/728px-Igbat.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Remove the LED light battery box from the igniter box. Install 2 AA batteries as shown and re-install the battery box into the igniter assembly. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Iglight.jpg/459px-Iglight.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/0/0a/Iglight.jpg/728px-Iglight.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Installing the LP Gas Tank Confirm the LP gas tank is full. Check if the tank is full; if the tank is not full, exchange it for a full tank. Install the LP gas tank onto the grill. Check that the tank valve is closed before starting. Open the right-side door and locate the tank holder. Flip the tank holding latch to the right so the tank holder can slide out. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/FlipR.jpg/459px-FlipR.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/6/62/FlipR.jpg/728px-FlipR.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Loosen the retention screw on the tank holder. Set the tank to the base sits in the open circle of the tank holder. Make sure the tank is oriented so the valve will face the right side of the tank when pushed back. Tighten the retention screw. Push the tank holder back into place and flip the tank holding latch to the left so the tank hold can't move. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cd/SlideBack.jpg/459px-SlideBack.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/c/cd/SlideBack.jpg/728px-SlideBack.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Connect the LP hose and regulator to the LP gas tank. Grab the LP hose and regulator that is located inside the right door or the grill. Holding the gas tank with one hand insert the brass nipple from the LP tank into the large black plastic nut. Turn the nut clockwise by hand until it stops turning. It is very important to make sure the hose is not damaged and has no kinks.
